page.title: 08FISHING
page.content: Catterline is a small fishing village about 6 miles south of Stonehaven. With a small harbour for the only boat that goes out to sea, it is a beautiful sight especially on summer evenings. The fishermen have a busy day, starting at 5.30 a.m. till 11.00 a.m. Baiting the fish at 2.30 p.m. till 4.45 p.m. means a long day. Amongst the catch there is a variety which includes lobsters, crabs and fish. Creels are used for catching lobsters about 1 or 2 in each creel. I wonder what will happen when the last boat stops going to sea? We'll just have to wait and see.
